metadata.title: CVE-2021-24001 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A compromised content process could have performed session historymanipulations it should not have been able to due to testing infrastructurethat was not restricted to testing-only configurations. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-24001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
